intro: Platysepalum chrysophyllum, commonly known as the golden star plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its attractive, star-shaped yellow flowers. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for tropical gardens and indoor plant collections.
